entry.title: Reland "Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 68270ff9259076cd7bc9b398f88d4043166ee676



Problem was that `last_autofill_action_` was used before being

initialized because of a dummy call to form_util::ClearPreviewedElements

and this caused uninitialized memory error.



Original change's description:

> Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer

>

> This CL:

> -Adds a mojom::AutofillFormAction enum denoting the browser autofill

> operation that sent a form to the renderer.

> -Adds an ApplyAutofillAction function to form_util with intent to merge

> the two deleted functions.

> -Adapts FillFormField and PreviewFormField and ClearPreviewedElements

> to handle both Fill and Undo operations.

> -Fixes typos and clang warnings in touched files

>

> The overall chain of CLs adds a preview feature to the existing Undo

> functionality. Up until this CL, the browser has the required logic and

> sends the necessary information to the renderer. This CL's goal is to

> first make Undo previewable and second merge the Undo and Fill functions

> in the renderer because they are highly similar.

>

> Bug: 1441410

> Change-Id: Id2ce96d4df2318469a2a2578257040840009e30c

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4664652

> Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

> Reviewed-by: Christoph Schwering

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Commit-Queue: Jihad Hanna

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181334}



Bug: 1441410

entry.title: Reland "[Sync] Persist local_data_out_of_sync and fix deletion of metadata corresponding to the local session"
entry.content:
This reverts commit cf641d613df6b2f0a526df687d4cad5f9f24e659.



Reason for revert: not actually the culprit for the test failures.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[Sync] Persist local_data_out_of_sync and fix deletion of metadata corresponding to the local session"

>

> This reverts commit 05814c3e332d07ebe24cec4b6c7ddf46ca8403dd.

>

> Reason for revert: causing persistent failures in services_unittests,

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25787/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > [Sync] Persist local_data_out_of_sync and fix deletion of metadata corresponding to the local session

> >

> > This is a continuation of the work in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4748603

> > which I'm taking over. Credit to mastiz@ for most of this change.

> >

> > If sync metadata is deleted from storage, SessionStore will ignore the

> > tab upon browser restart. This is problematic on Android because

> > placeholder tabs rely on the information being restored from

> > SessionStore.

> >

> > This CL changes the behavior of remote deletion of the local session

> > so that in addition to resubmitting the local session data the metadata

> > changes are also dropped. This prevents the deletion from SessionStore

> > so that placeholder tabs are retained and resubmitted.

> >

> > Also move SyncingState.local_data_out_of_sync into SessionSyncPrefs to

> > persist across restarts. This avoids an issue where on a quick

> > restart this bit may be lost causing data to not be resubmitted and

> > fight back against the remote deletion.

> >

> > Bug: 1463772

> > Change-Id: I5b85f5424ab0e7ab93759f264408a7e9d2d4d232

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4748782

> > Commit-Queue: Calder Kitagawa

> > Reviewed-by: Marc Treib

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1180991}

>

> Bug: 1463772

> Change-Id: I8d96475a09b73430a06eefcbd0fd2def01cfdcca

entry.title: Fix StyleImageSet::CanRender() handling of no image selected
entry.content:
If no image was selected [1], the image-set() is an "invalid image" [2].

Thus CanRender() should return false if `best_fit_image_` is null.



[1] "If there are no left at this point, the function

represents an invalid image."

(https://drafts.csswg.org/css-images-4/#image-set-notation)

[2] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-images-4/#invalid-image



Bug: 1471213

entry.title: [min-font-size] Stop localizing "Minimum font size"
entry.content:
This patch stops localized default value for the ""Minimum

font size."



This feature was originally introduced for the readability on

high-DPI devices and for the accessibility, and it was

localized. But then it was turned to the accessibility feature,

therefore localization is no longer needed.



This patch stops doing it because the localization of this

setting is causing interoperability and accessibility issues.



Please see more details and the discussion with the i18n team

in the design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/u/1/d/180f-ex4Nj11lExg80ziZZ8Bc-LxQU6B9wY-WEZksLM0/edit?usp=sharing



The Intent to Ship thread:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/QpQeCiNGhDs/m/LNQlYXcmAwAJ



Manually tested a local build:

* Without this patch, and restart after switching to Japanese

UI, it's 10.

* Build with this patch, it becomes 0.

* With this patch and run with the option:

`--disable-features=UnlocalizeMinimumFontSize`

it's 10.



Bug: 1469490

Change-Id: I5149beaeff541ea3b132be8739f12ef7d1eacdf8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4764565

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

entry.title: Dont use NativeThemeFluent when OverlayScrollbars are on.
entry.content:
Overlay Scrollbars (enabled via chrome://flags or command line argument

--enable-features=OverlaySCrollbar) use NativeThemeAura; if they are

enabled we shouldn't use Fluent Scrollbar's Native Theme. With this

change, if both flags are enabled Overlay Scrollbars take precedence.

entry.title: Add needed bits to start honoring target in event rewriters
entry.content:
This is the base change required to start honoring event target in event

rewriting flow, as discussed in [1]. The broader change is aimed at

avoiding crashes like the ones observed in [2], which happens because

Lacros window/tab dragging code assumes mouse drag events to have its

target set, while AutoClickDragEventRewriter as well as some generic

event rewriting code (eg: EventSource::SendEventToSinkFromRewriter) do

not honor the event target.



This CL changes the logic in the core ui::EventSource impl when

rewriting events with location != root_location, removing the assumption

that event target must not be honored by event rewriters. Instead, is

now requires it to be honored and (consequently) no longer sets the

cloned event's location == root_location. This new behavior for now

depends on the rewriter impl to return true for its override of the

brand new SupportsNonRootLocation() method added by this CL.



The child CLs will implement the logic and test expectation updates

required in rewriter implementations.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3917385/comment/918be9b4_1662dc11/

[2] https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1347192



Bug: 1459680, 1347192

Test: events_unittests (EventRewriterTest.* test cases).

Change-Id: Icfd521f4c3b2826c6796e44150561f7634002b94

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3917385

Commit-Queue: Nick Yamane

entry.title: Fenced Frames: Add WPT checks for requestedSize API.
entry.content:
For all existing tests that pass requestedSize to the auctionConfig:



- A URL param with the same width and height from requestedSize is

passed in the bidding and decision logic URLs.

- The serving code for both bidding and decision inserts requestedSize

checks in the returned Javascript.

- Those checks confirm that the requestedSize in the browserSignals

(for bidding) or auctionConfig (for decision) have the same values as

the URL param. If the JS objects and the URL param don't match, an

error is thrown.



With this method, we can confirm at runtime that the requestedSize is

plumbed through the browser correctly, because the generated Javascript

knows what the plumbed value is supposed to be.



Change-Id: I36664db6e4a62c62e13dbcce86d78eabb8937b6b

entry.title: [text-autospace] Insert spacing at autospace points
entry.content:
Implements the spacing insertion logic based on

https://crrev.com/c/4729446.



It is behind the RuntimeEnabled flag of `CSSTextAutoSpace`.

This feature flag is disabled in tests by https://crrev.com/c/4755019,

to make other web tests run without this flag enabled.



We are disabling this flag, because it changes the default behavior of

renderer engine, so the test expectation files of the affected tests

are no longer correct after this feature is enabled.

To avoid affecting the wpt tests before this feature is fully ready,

that CL only enables the CSSTextAutoSpace flag in VirtualTestSuite,

so then we can test its behavior separately.



Follow-ups will:

- update the test expectation files of the affected tests and

add them to the virtual test suite.

- add e2e web tests.

to the page under test changing background color automatically. This CL

entry.title: [iOS] Only reorder overflow menu on first open
entry.content:
The menu shouldn't be changing order multiple times while the menu is open, as that can be confusing to users. This CL breaks up menu

modification into a few different parts. There's one method that's

called once per menu opening that does any reordering necessary for

badging or destination usage history. Then there's a second method

that's called whenever the menu needs to update that handles showing or

hiding individual items based on page state.



This CL also adds another method to alert the order when the menu

disappears, so it can update badge impression data correctly.

entry.title: Fix flakiness of paint/markers/marker-invalidation.html
entry.content:
paint/markers/marker-invalidation.html flakes with no spelling

marker. A potential culprit is that the test ends before the spelling

markers are added due to not calling waitUntilDone:

onload = runAfterLayoutAndPaint(function() {

addSpellingMarker(markAllSpelling, 0, 10);

}, false);

The false argument of runAfterLayoutAndPaint results in not calling

waitUntilDone.

entry.title: DOM Parts speed optimization patch 2/N
entry.content:
This CL includes many small optimizations:

- Several CHECKs become DCHECKs.

- HasDOMParts() goes away, and is replaced by GetDOMParts().

- GetDOMParts() is now stored as a HeapDeque rather than a

HeapLinkedHashSet, to avoid the speed penalties from keeping the

hashset. This requires one potentially slow case, when a Node has

more than one Part and the Deque has to be iterated to remove it.

But in practice, this is rare.

- GetDOMParts() also now returns PartsList* rather than a copy of the

PartsList.

- We only call QueueForCloning() on the NodeToSortBy() to avoid

multiple queues of the same Part.

- We stop calling AddDOMPart() on the ChildNodePart parent element.

We never needed it anyway.



These changes are covered by the existing basic-dom-part-objects.tentative.html test.

entry.title: [Tracing] Use Perfetto client library for tracing on Android
entry.content:
This CL switches the Chrome tracing backend to Perfetto client

library. It means that Chrome on Android will use a different set of

TRACE_EVENT* macros that call Perfetto client API under the hood.



The Perfetto backend has been the default on desktop Linux since

March. Now we make it the default on Android too. Our end goal is to

make Perfetto the default backend on all platforms, unblocking

multiple improvements in tracing stability and usefulness.



Significant effort has been made to make the binary size impact as

small as possible, but some overhead remains. See this thread:

for more info and discussion.

entry.title: FLEDGE: Add more granular dump cases in OnAuctionComplete.
entry.content:
See crbug.com/1422301 for the crash this CL is investigating.



From existing dumps, it is clear that the fenced frame mapping has

changed in middle of an auction. It is unclear what leads to this. Unfortunately, we are unable to examine local variable from minidump. Plus efforts to reproduce this crash had no success.



My hypothesis is that the root cause can be one of the following:

1. The render frame host has changed.

2. The render frame host is the same, but its page has changed.

3. Neither render from host nor the page has changed, but the fenced

frame mapping owned by the page has changed.



Add more cases to identify which one is the root cause. In the crash

report the stack trace will show line number so that we can tell which

branch it hits.



Bug: 1422301

entry.title: [A11y] Implement value handling for meter role
entry.content:
According to the ARIA spec[1], values of the meter role are processed in

the following rules.

* If aria-valuemin is missing or not a number, it defaults to 0

* If aria-valuemax is missing or not a number, it defaults to 100.

* If aria-valuenow is missing or not a number, it defaults to aria-valuemin.

entry.title: DOM Parts speed optimization patch 1/N
entry.content:
This is the first of several patches to improve the speed of the DOM

Parts API. This patch simply adds a set of performance tests for the

API, including speed measurements for cloning, appending, and gathering

Part lists. Those three times are measured for three cases:

1. Plain comments without the DOM Parts API, which are searched via

a TreeWalker.

2. DOM Parts where all Parts are linked to a single DocumentPartRoot.

3. DOM Parts where lower layers of Parts are connected to higher

layers of ChildNodeParts.



This CL also adds a manual test that exercises the same tests, but

in an interactive fashion.

entry.title: [iOS] Move actions on the tab grid out of synchronization disabler
entry.content:
Reland "[iOS] Disable EarlGrey synchronization when accessing camera"



This is a reland of commit 9372c83b9c10e5e73428b558aea4b6e8f0fd9a6a,

and an attempt to fix testDismissPermissionsWhenIncognitoKilled which

has failed since the update.



Original failure message states that it could not find the close button

of the test tab on the tab grid, but the element could be located in the

printed UI hierarchy.



Judging from the long list of currently animating elements at the end of

the message, I suspect that the error was due to that the assertion was

performed with synchronization disabled. Moving the lines of code out

as the video element would not be visible at its full size when that

assertion is performed.



Original change's description:

> [iOS] Disable EarlGrey synchronization when accessing camera

>

> It is suspected that the video element in the test page performs some

> fast repetitive animations that, combined with the EarlGrey

> synchronization, delays the invocation of the infobar appearance

> animation completion block. As a workaround, we disables EarlGrey

> synchronization whenever the test is showing the video element.

>

> Change-Id: I914999fd925ce9220842a6d7b5e27370f5cf670e

entry.title: base::RandBytes: switch implementation to BoringSSL
entry.content:
On POSIX:



1. Remove the experiments to compare the RAND_bytes (from BoringSSL)

with getrandom(2).



2. Simplify to remove getrandom(2) entirely. This leads to

base::internal::RandDoubleAvoidAllocation() not being able to use

faster fallbacks: getrandom(2) on Linux/Android and getentropy(3) on

MacOS. These calls should not happen often in the field, so the

platform-specific conditional compilation with runtime kernel version

detection needed for those fallbacks are not worth keeping.



On Windows and Fuchsia: Remove the BoringSSL experiment in the most

straightforward way.



Also remove the experiment from the fieldtrial_testing_config.

entry.title: [Bookmarks] client_ gets destructed before the observer list.
entry.content:
Before this CL, the observer list was destructed before client_.

Since `client_` owns a BookmarkClient and some client (at least

`ChromeBookmarkClient`) observer the bookmark model, it is

important that the client is destructed before the list. This caused

the destruction of a non-empty list.



While reordering parameters would suffice to ensure the right order,

adding the destruction of the client explicitly in the destructor of

the model ensure that this requirement is explicitly met, even if

members of the class were to be reordered.



`TutledUrlIndex` owns a `TypedCountSorter` that keeps a raw_ptr to the client. So `titled_url_index_` must be reset before the `client_`.

Hence this CL also had to explicitly stops `titled_url_index_` before

`client_`.



There may remain more dependencies in the order of destructor that are

not explicited in comment. The goal of this CL was not to make them

all explicit, only to ensure the observer list contains less elements

at destruction time.







This CL will allow to check it on observer list destruction in

crrev.com/c/4742500.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Icaeee162580848829ff83861d1ed561df929de1f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4755448

entry.title: Revert "avif_image_decoder: Use libavif's yuv to rgb function"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 56846997d568ab8fadddfc2605a2f891231d6524.



Reason for revert: Seems to be causing blink_platform_unittests failures like https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25787/overview



Original change's description:

> avif_image_decoder: Use libavif's yuv to rgb function

>

> Get rid of the pixel by pixel loop in the wrapper and use

> libavif's conversion function instead. It uses libyuv if the

> image's color configuration supports it, otherwise has built-in C

> code which is slightly faster in some cases. It also has support

> for multi-threaded conversion which is better.

>

> The PaintCanvasVideoRenderer (PCVR) path is still retained and

> will be used if the image's color configuration supports it.

>

> Also relax the pixel error tolerance from 1 to 2 for two 12-bit

> YUVA test images because libavif uses libyuv for those files.

> libyuv's fixed-point arithmetic is less accurate than

> gfx::ColorTransform's floating-point arithmetic (similar to

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3546131)

>

> Performance is mostly neutral with some files being ~50% faster.

>

> Binary size increase is due to a few new libavif functions being

> accessed. Worth the performance/code re-use benefits.

>

> Change-Id: Ib61bc7a8905b986c946f97e4791f02d81d1af3fe

> Binary-Size: See reasoning above.

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4698835

> Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

> Reviewed-by: Wan-Teh Chang

> Commit-Queue: Vignesh Venkat

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181018}

entry.title: Revert "[Sync] Persist local_data_out_of_sync and fix deletion of metadata corresponding to the local session"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 05814c3e332d07ebe24cec4b6c7ddf46ca8403dd.



Reason for revert: causing persistent failures in services_unittests,

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25787/overview



Original change's description:

> [Sync] Persist local_data_out_of_sync and fix deletion of metadata corresponding to the local session

>

> This is a continuation of the work in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4748603

> which I'm taking over. Credit to mastiz@ for most of this change.

>

> If sync metadata is deleted from storage, SessionStore will ignore the

> tab upon browser restart. This is problematic on Android because

> placeholder tabs rely on the information being restored from

> SessionStore.

>

> This CL changes the behavior of remote deletion of the local session

> so that in addition to resubmitting the local session data the metadata

> changes are also dropped. This prevents the deletion from SessionStore

> so that placeholder tabs are retained and resubmitted.

>

> Also move SyncingState.local_data_out_of_sync into SessionSyncPrefs to

> persist across restarts. This avoids an issue where on a quick

> restart this bit may be lost causing data to not be resubmitted and

> fight back against the remote deletion.

>

> Bug: 1463772

> Change-Id: I5b85f5424ab0e7ab93759f264408a7e9d2d4d232

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4748782

> Commit-Queue: Calder Kitagawa

> Reviewed-by: Marc Treib

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1180991}

entry.title: [iOS] Allow Spacing Increase If Info Button Is Hidden
entry.content:
TableViewInfoButtonItem has functionality to hide the info button, but

the constraint wasn't properly set up in a way where the UI looked like

space was added for a button that was invisible. Please see UI

screenshot for reference. Although this is what happens visually, what

actually is causing this UI bug is the logic that space is added for

`statusTextLabel` even if it doesn't exist. To fix this, we separate

the constraints related to the UILabel and activate/deactivate related

constraints based on if the UILabel was initialized.



UI Screenshots:

Standard:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BiVEYgonMyHByjVoXNi8X2a17608Azc-/view?usp=drive_link&resourcekey=0-0URX4AvIJUOIstkYBBoODA



Accessibility Enabled:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TFJVUzOADdgrqnniPSRoySwqaGy1Rj5s/view?usp=drive_link&resourcekey=0-YwQEaToOjxlW8vRGK3euQQ

entry.title: [base][test] TestFuture: only initialize runloop inside Wait() call
entry.content:
Previously the TestFuture would create a RunLoop on construction,

thereby requiring that the calling thread already has a message-

pump associated with it.



In some tests the message-pump (usually TaskEnvironment) will

only be created after the test object's construction (e.g. as

part of SetUp()). Since those run after the test base-class has

been constructed, this would prevent TestFuture being a member

of the test base-class.



TestFuture now follows the best-practice of creating the RunLoop

only when it actually wants to run the message-pump, in Wait(),

allowing it to be created & destroyed independent of the

message-pump lifetime.



Bug: b:287939427

entry.title: [autofill autocomplete] Remove mouse observed outside bounds check for autocomplete being deleted case.
entry.content:
When an autocomplete entry is deleted the whole popup is recreated. This leads to the cursor being inside a row from the beginning. Due to our mouse being outside the bounds check, this forces the user to have to move the cursor out and in, which is annoying.



This code also deleted DeleteButtonAccessibilityDelegate which is no longer used, plus renames the method to create the autocomplete row.



please note: There is still a bug where a mouse movement is required to get the cell highlighted. I am working on it.

entry.title: [DBSC] Update `RegistrationTokenHelper` to support challenges
entry.content:
The registration endpoint requires a challenge to be signed and attached

to the DBSC session registration request. This is step 1 of adding

support for handling the server-issued challenges. In this CL we update

entry.title: Revert "Remove dependency in //content/child on //components/autofill"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8d89dfa60440c6097262793f332bb1985fc79829.



Reason for revert: to be replaced by crrev.com/c/4760966.



As suggested by John, //content should not know about Autofill and

thus should not contain an Autofill base::Feature.



We can call blink::WebRuntimeFeatures::EnableSharedAutofill()

manually in ChromeContentRendererClient::

SetRuntimeFeaturesDefaultsBeforeBlinkInitialization() instead.



Original change's description:

> Remove dependency in //content/child on //components/autofill

>

> This CL moves autofill::features::kAutofillSharedAutofill from

> //components/autofill to //content to eliminate the dependency

> in //content/child on //components/autofill.

>

> As a result, a unit test that depends on the kAutofillSharedAutofill

> moves from //components/autofill/core to ../content.

>

> Bug: 1201849

entry.title: Avoid dangling reference to MigratableCreditCard in MigrateCardsRequest.
entry.content:
Currently, MigrateCardsRequest has a reference that can become dangling:

1) On construction, MigrateCardsRequest stores a reference to a vector

of MigratableCreditCard that is owned by the caller.

2) However, the caller is FormDataImporter and FormDataImporter's

lifetime is shorter than that of the MigrateCardsRequest: The former

gets destroyed before PaymentsClient

(the owner of MigrateCardsRequest) and the destruction order is

correct, because members of FormDataImporter assume that

PaymentClient outlives them.

3) Therefore, on destruction of AutofillClient (but potentially also

in other scenarios if FormDataImporter ever resets its members)

the reference that MigrateCardsRequest keeps, becomes invalid.



This CL changes MigrateCardsRequest to keep a copy instead.



However, this change triggered a few more build config changes:

- MigrateCardsRequest only exists on Desktop, but was previously

included for all OSes. However, MigratableCreditCard is not included

in the iOS and Android builds. As soon as one changes the member from

a reference to a vector to an actual vector, a forward declaration

is no longer enough.

- This CL therefore also excludes MigrateCardsRequest from iOS and

Android builds. This should slightly improve binary size (by ~2.7 KB)

at the cost of a few ifdefs.



Bug: 1468967

Change-Id: I83f7cec6a8abcfc1133292a7bf1d566f1a145d3f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4753425

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Olivia Saul

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

Reviewed-by: Florian Leimgruber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181406}

entry.title: Revert "Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 68270ff9259076cd7bc9b398f88d4043166ee676.



Reason for revert: Likely the cause of crbug.com/1471415



Original change's description:

> Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer

>

> This CL:

> -Adds a mojom::AutofillFormAction enum denoting the browser autofill

> operation that sent a form to the renderer.

> -Adds an ApplyAutofillAction function to form_util with intent to merge

> the two deleted functions.

> -Adapts FillFormField and PreviewFormField and ClearPreviewedElements

> to handle both Fill and Undo operations.

> -Fixes typos and clang warnings in touched files

>

> The overall chain of CLs adds a preview feature to the existing Undo

> functionality. Up until this CL, the browser has the required logic and

> sends the necessary information to the renderer. This CL's goal is to

> first make Undo previewable and second merge the Undo and Fill functions

> in the renderer because they are highly similar.

>
